<div style="overflow: auto; margin-bottom: 20px;">

Gabriela successfully defended her doctoral dissertation, entitled *What makes a teacher? attitudes toward teachers’ language varieties in the Spanish language classroom*, in November 2024. In addition to advisor Kendra Dickinson, [Dr. Joseph Casillas](https://www.jvcasillas.com/about.html), [Dr. Tom Stephens](https://span-port.rutgers.edu/people/faculty/faculty-directory/164-stephens-thomas-m), and [Dr. Victor Fernández-Mallat](https://spanport.washington.edu/people/victor-fernandez-mallat) served on her committee. Read her dissertation [here](https://rucore.libraries.rutgers.edu/rutgers-lib/73388/).

</div>

Since mid-2024, Gabriela has been working at Drexel University’s Teaching and Learning Center as Assistant Director of Online and Digital Pedagogy. In this role, Gabriela has put her commitment to inclusive teaching, accessibility, and language justice into practice to make a different in the learning experiences of students at Drexel University. We can't wait to see what she does next.
